alert.note: Alert for Major; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 1:50AM CDT until May 25 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Waynoka affecting Woodward, Major and Woods Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Waynoka. * WHEN...From early this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull conditions exist along the river... and some overflows may occur over some low-lying areas near the river. The river reach affected extends from near Freedom upstream... to the U.S. Highway 281 crossing south of Little Sahara State Park near Waynoka... to near Orienta in Major County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 5.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 7.9 feet this evening. It will then fall to 7.2 feet and begin rising again tomorrow morning and is expected to remain about 7 feet into tomorrow evening before falling. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
